title: Deputies or assistants to department heads
context: §26-53 Deputies or assistants to department heads. Effective July 1, 2004, the salaries of deputies or assistants to the head of any department of the State, other than the department of education, shall be within the range or ranges for the specific positions as last recommended by the executive salary commission. Effective July 1, 2007, and every six years thereafter, the salaries shall be as last recommended by the commission on salaries and specified by the appointing official, if appropriate, pursuant to section 26-56, unless rejected by the legislature. [L 1965, c 223, pt of §5; Supp, §4A-3; HRS §26-53; am L 1975, c 58, §7; am L 1982, c 129, §1(3); am L 1986, c 128, §1(3); am L 1989, c 329, §1(3); am L 2003, c 122, §4 and c 187, §2; am L 2006, c 299, §4] Cross References Nonapplicability to: Administrative services manager of department of attorney general, see §28-7.5. Special assistant to attorney general, see §28-8.5. Special assistant to state librarian, see §312-2.2. Salary of various department of education deputies and assistants, see §302A-621.
